title: Inefficient Hot Dogs
summary:
Key ideas
- Why do hot dogs come in packs of ten and buns in packs of eight?
- This equilibrium shouldn't last in a free market.
- Companies should offer what consumers are looking for.

Key learnings
- Companies may not respond to incentives for indefinite periods of time based on tradition.
- Even seemingly trivial issues can reveal larger economic phenomena.

Key questions
- Why do companies fail to respond to consumer demand in some cases?
- How does tradition impact market equilibrium?
